Those are the ones whom God has sealed upon their hearts, and they followed their desires.                                                                                                                                                                                             |||
| 047:017 | And those who are guided, He increases their guidance, and grants them their righteousness.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |||
| 047:018 | So are they waiting until the Hour comes to them suddenly? For its conditions have already been met. But once it comes to them, how will they benefit from their message?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |||
| 047:019 | So know that there is no god besides God, and ask forgiveness of your sins and also for the believing men and believing women. And God knows your movements and your place of rest.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |||
| ------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 047:020 | And those who believe Say: "If only a chapter is sent down\!" But when a firm chapter is sent down, and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those who have a disease in their hearts look at you, as if death had already come to them. It thus revealed them. |||
| 047:021 | Obedience and to speak righteousness until the matter is decided, then if they trust God it would be better for them.                                                                                                                                           |||
| 047:022 | So do you plan that when you turn away, that you will corrupt the land and sever your family ties?                                                                                                                                                              |||
| 047:023 | These are the ones whom God has cursed and thus He made them deaf and blinded their sight.                                                                                                                                                                      |||
| 047:024 | Do they not reflect on the Quran? Or are there locks on their hearts?                                                                                                                                                                                           |||
| 047:025 | Surely, those who reverted back, after the guidance has been made clear to them, the devil has enticed them and led them on.                                                                                                                                    |||
| 047:026 | That is because they said to those who hated what God had sent down: "We will obey you in certain matters." And God knows their secrets.                                                                                                                        |||
| 047:027 | So how will it be when the Angels put them to death, striking their faces and their backs?                                                                                                                                                                      |||
| 047:028 | That is because they followed that which angered God, and they hated that which pleased Him. Thus, He nullified their works.                                                                                                                                    |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |||
| ------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 047:029 | Or did those who harbour a disease in their hearts think that God would not bring out their evil thoughts?                                                                                                                                                                                           |||
| 047:030 | And if We wished, We would show them to you so you would recognize them by their looks. However, you can recognize them by their speech. And God is fully aware of your works.                                                                                                                       |||
| 047:031 | And We will test you until We know those who strive among you and those who are patient. And We will bring out your qualities.                                                                                                                                                                       |||
| 047:032 | Those who have rejected and repelled from the path of God, and stood against the messenger after the guidance has been made clear for them, they will not harm God in the least, and He will nullify their works.                                                                                    |||
| 047:033 | O you who believe, obey God, and obey the messenger. And do not render your work in vain.                                                                                                                                                                                                            |||
| 047:034 | Surely, those who rejected and repelled from the path of God, then they died while still rejecting, God will never forgive them.                                                                                                                                                                     |||
| 047:035 | Therefore, do not be weak and ask for peace, for you are on a higher moral ground, and God is with you. And He will not waste your efforts.                                                                                                                                                          |||
| 047:036 | This worldly life is no more than play and vanity. But if you believe and lead a righteous life, He will reward you, and He will not ask you for your wealth.                                                                                                                                        |||
| 047:037 | If He were to ask you for it, to the extent of creating a hardship for you, you would become stingy, and your hidden evil might be exposed.                                                                                                                                                          |||
| 047:038 | Here you are being invited to spend in the cause of God, but some among you turn stingy. And whoever is stingy is only being stingy on himself. And God is the Rich, while you are the poor. And if you turn away, He will substitute another people instead of you, then they will not be like you. |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |||
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
|         | In the name of God, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |||
| 048:001 | We have given you a clear conquest.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |||
| 048:002 | So that God may forgive your present sins, as well as those past, and so that He may complete His blessings upon you, and guide you on [a straight path](/w/index.php?title=Quran_as-Sirat_al-Mustaqeem&action=edit&redlink=1 "Quran as-Sirat al-Mustaqeem (page does not exist)").         |||
| 048:003 | And God will grant you a conquest which is mighty.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |||
| 048:004 | He is the One who sends down tranquility into the hearts of the believers, so that they may increase in faith along with their present faith. And to God belongs the soldiers of the heavens and the Earth, and God is Knowledgeable, Wise.                                                 |||
| 048:005 | That He may admit the believing men and believing women into Gardens with rivers flowing beneath them, abiding eternally therein, and He will remit their sins from them. And with God this is a great triumph.                                                                             |||
| 048:006 | And He will punish the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women, and the idolater men and the idolater women, who think evil thoughts about God. Their evil will come back to them, and God was angry with them, and He has cursed them and prepared for them Hell. What a miserable destiny\! |||
| 048:007 | And to God belongs the soldiers of the heavens and the Earth. And God is Noble, Wise.                                                                                                                                                                                                       |||
| 048:008 | We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good news, and a warner.                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |||
| 048:009 | So that you may believe in God and His messenger, and that you may support Him, honour Him, and glorify Him, morning and evening.                                                                                                                                                           |||
| 048:010 | Those who pledge allegiance to you, are in-fact pledging allegiance to God; God's hand is above their hands. Those of them who violate such a pledge, are violating it only upon themselves. And whosoever fulfills what he has pledged to God, then He will grant him a great reward.      |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |||
| ------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 048:011 | The Nomads who lagged behind will say to you: "We were preoccupied with our money and our family, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: "Who then would possess any power for you against God if He wanted harm to afflict you or if He wanted benefit for you?" No, God is fully Aware of everything you do. |||
| 048:012 | Alas, you thought that the messenger and the believers would not return to their families, and this was deemed pleasant in your hearts, and you thought the worst thoughts; you were a wicked people.                                                                                                                                                             |||
| 048:013 | Anyone who does not believe in God and His messenger, then We have prepared for the rejecters a Hellfire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |||
| 048:014 | And to God is the sovereignty of the heavens and the Earth. He forgives whomever He wills, and punishes whomever He wills. God is Forgiver, Merciful.                                                                                                                                                                                                             |||
| 048:015 | Those who lagged behind will say, when you venture out to collect the spoils: "Let us follow you\!" They want to change God's words. Say: "You will not follow us; this is what God has decreed beforehand." They will then Say: "No, you are envious of us." Alas, they rarely understood anything.                                                              |||
| 048:016 | Say to those Nomads who lagged behind: "You will be called on to fight a people who are very powerful in warfare, unless they surrender. Then if you obey, God will grant you a good reward, but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful retribution."                                                                      |||
| 048:017 | There is no burden on the blind, nor is there any burden on the cripple, nor is there on the sick any burden. And whosoever obeys God and His messenger, He will admit them into paradises with rivers flowing beneath; and whosoever turns away, He will punish him with a painful retribution.                                                                  |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |||
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |||
| 048:018 | God is pleased with the believers who pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He thus knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them, and rewarded them with a near victory.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |||
| 048:019 | And abundant spoils that they will take. God is Noble, Wise.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |||
| 048:020 | God has promised you abundant spoils that you will take. Thus He has hastened this for you, and He has withheld the people's hands against you; that it may be a sign for the believers, and that He may guide you to [a straight path](/w/index.php?title=Quran_as-Sirat_al-Mustaqeem&action=edit&redlink=1 "Quran as-Sirat al-Mustaqeem (page does not exist)").                                                                                                 |||
| 048:021 | And the other group which you could not vanquish, God took care of them. And God was capable of all things.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |||
| 048:022 | And if the rejecters had fought you, they would have turned and ran, then they would have found neither an ally nor a victor.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |||
| 048:023 | Such is God's way with those who have passed away before, and you will not find any change in God's way.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |||
| 048:024 | And He is the One who withheld their hands against you, and your hands against them in the interior of Mecca, after He had made you victorious over them. God is Seer of what you do.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |||
| 048:025 | They are the ones who rejected and barred you from the Restricted Temple, and barred your donations from reaching their destination. And there had been believing men and women whom you did not know, and you may have hurt them, and on whose account you would have committed a sin unknowingly. God will admit into His mercy whomever He wills. Had they become separated, We would then have punished those of them who rejected with a painful retribution. |||
| 048:026 | Those who rejected had put in their hearts the rage of the days of ignorance, then God sent down tranquility upon His messenger and the believers, and directed them to uphold the word of righteousness, and they were well entitled to it and worthy of it. And God is fully aware of all things.                                                                                                                                                                |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |||
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 048:027 | God has fulfilled with truth His messenger's vision: "You will enter the Restricted Temple, God willing, secure, with your heads shaven and shortened, having no fear." Thus, He knew what you did not know, and He has coupled with this a near victory.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |||
| 048:028 | He is the One who sent His messenger with the guidance and the system of truth, so that it would expose all other systems. And God is sufficient as a witness.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |||
| 048:029 | Mohammed is the messenger of God, and those who are with him are severe against the rejecters, but merciful between themselves. You see them kneeling and prostrating, they seek God's blessings and approval. Their distinction is in their faces, as a result of prostrating. Such is their example in the Torah. And their example in the Injeel is like a plant which shoots out and becomes strong and thick and it stands straight on its trunk, pleasing to the farmers. That He may enrage the rejecters with them. God promises those among them who believe and do good works a forgiveness and a great reward. |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |||
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |||
|         | In the name of God, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |||
| 049:001 | O you who believe, do not place your opinion above that of God and His messenger. And be aware of God. God is Hearer, Knowledgeable.                                                                                                                                                                                                             |||
| 049:002 | O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet, nor shall you speak loudly at him as you would speak loudly to each other, lest your works become nullified while you do not perceive.                                                                                                                               |||
| 049:003 | Surely, those who lower their voices with the messenger of God, they are the ones whose hearts have been tested by God for righteousness. They have deserved forgiveness and a great recompense.                                                                                                                                                 |||
| 049:004 | Surely, those who call on you from behind the buildings, most of them do not comprehend.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |||
| 049:005 | And if they had only been patient till you came out to them, it would have been better for them. God is Forgiver, Merciful.                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |||
| 049:006 | O you who believe, if a wicked person comes to you with any news, then you shall investigate it. Lest you harm a people out of ignorance, then you will become regretful over what you have done.                                                                                                                                                |||
| 049:007 | And know that among you is the messenger of God. If he were to obey you in many things, you would be in difficulty. But God made you love faith and He adorned it in your hearts, and He made you hate disbelief, wickedness, and disobedience. These are the rightly guided ones.                                                               |||
| 049:008 | Such is the grace from God and a blessing. God is Knowledgeable, Wise.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |||
| 049:009 | And if two parties of believers battle with each other, you shall reconcile them; but if one of them aggresses against the other, then you shall fight the one aggressing until it complies with God's command. Once it complies, then you shall reconcile the two groups with justice, and be equitable; for God loves those who are equitable. |||
| 049:010 | The believers are brothers; so reconcile between your brothers, and be aware of God, that you may receive mercy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |||
| ------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 049:011 | O you who believe, let not a people ridicule other people, for they may be better than they. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than they. Nor shall you mock one another, or call each other names. Evil indeed is the reversion to wickedness after attaining faith. And anyone who does not repent, then these are the transgressors. |||
| 049:012 | O you who believe, you shall avoid much suspicion, for some suspicion is sinful. And do not spy on one another, nor shall you backbite one another. Would one of you enjoy eating the flesh of his dead brother? You certainly would hate this. You shall observe God. God is Redeemer, Merciful.                                                                      |||
| 049:013 | O mankind, We created you from a male and female, and We made you into nations and tribes, that you may know one another. Surely, the most honourable among you in the sight of God is the most righteous. God is Knowledgeable, Expert.                                                                                                                               |||
| 049:014 | The Nomads said: "We believe." Say: "You have not believed; but you should Say: 'We have surrendered', for belief has not yet entered into your hearts." If you obey God and His messenger, He will not put any of your works to waste. God is Forgiver, Merciful.                                                                                                     |||
| 049:015 | Believers are those who believe in God and His messenger, then they became without doubt, and they strive with their money and their lives in the cause of God. These are the truthful ones.                                                                                                                                                                           |||
| 049:016 | Say: "Are you teaching God about your system while God knows everything in the heavens and the Earth? God is knowledgeable of all things."                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |||
| 049:017 | They think they are doing you a favour by having surrendered\! Say: "Do not think you are doing me any favours by your surrender. For it is God who is doing you a favour that He has guided you to the faith, if you are being true."                                                                                                                                 |||
| 049:018 | Surely, God knows all the unseen in the heavens and the Earth; God is Seer of everything you do.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |||

|         |                                                                                                                               |||
| ------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
|         | In the name of God, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.                                                                          |||
| 050:001 | Q, and the Quran of glory.                                                                                                    |||
| 050:002 | Are they surprised that a warner has come to them from amongst them, so the rejecters said: "This is something strange\!"     |||
| 050:003 | "Can it be that when we are dead and we become dust, that we come back later?"                                                |||
| 050:004 | We know which of them has become consumed with the Earth; and We have with Us a record which keeps track.                     |||
| 050:005 | But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused state.                                              |||
| 050:006 | Did they not look to the sky above them, how We built it, and adorned it, and how it has no openings?                         |||
| 050:007 | And the land We extended it, and placed in it stabilizers, and We gave growth in it to every kind of healthy pair.            |||
| 050:008 | Something to see and a reminder for every pious servant.                                                                      |||
| 050:009 | And We sent down from the sky blessed water, and We gave growth with it to gardens and grain that is harvested.               |||
| 050:010 | And the palm trees, emerging with clustering fruit.                                                                           |||
| 050:011 | A provision for the servants, and We gave life with it to the land which was dead. Such is the resurrection.                  |||
| 050:012 | Before their denial was that of the people of Noah, and the dwellers of Al-Raas, and Thamud.                                  |||
| 050:013 | And 'Aad, and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot.                                                                               |||
| 050:014 | And the people of the forest, and the people of Tubba\`. All of them disbelieved the messengers, so the promise came to pass. |||
| 050:015 | Did We have any difficulty in making the first creation? No, they are in confusion about the next creation.                   |||

|         |                                                                                                                    |||
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |||
| 050:016 | And We have created man and We know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than his jugular vein. |||
| 050:017 | When the two receivers meet on the right and on the left.                                                          |||
| 050:018 | He does not utter a word except with having a constant recorder.                                                   |||
| 050:019 | And the moment of death came in truth: "This is what you have been trying to avoid\!"                              |||
| 050:020 | And the horn is blown on the promised Day.                                                                         |||
| 050:021 | And every soul is brought, being driven, and with a witness.                                                       |||
| 050:022 | "You were heedless of this, so now We have removed your veil, and your sight today is iron\!"                      |||
| 050:023 | And his constant companion said: "Here is one who is a transgressor."                                              |||
| 050:024 | Cast in Hell every stubborn rejecter.                                                                              |||
| 050:025 | Denier of good, transgressor, doubter.                                                                             |||
| 050:026 | The one who made with God another god. So cast him into the severe retribution.                                    |||
| 050:027 | His constant companion said: "Our Lord, I did not corrupt him, but he was already far astray."                     |||
| 050:028 | He said: "Do not argue with each other before Me, I have already presented you with My promise."                   |||
| 050:029 | "The sentence will not be changed with Me, and I do not wrong the servants."                                       |||

|         |                                                                                                                                                     |||
| ------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 050:030 | The Day We say to Hell: "Are you full?", and it says: "I can take more."                                                                            |||
| 050:031 | And Paradise is brought near to the righteous, not far off.                                                                                         |||
| 050:032 | This is what you have been promised, for every obedient, steadfast                                                                                  |||
| 050:033 | The one who feared the Almighty while unseen, and came with a repenting heart                                                                       |||
| 050:034 | Enter it in peace. This is the Day of eternal life.                                                                                                 |||
| 050:035 | In it they will have what they wish, and We have even more.                                                                                         |||
| 050:036 | And how many a generation before them have We destroyed? They were stronger in power, and they had dominated the land. Did they find any sanctuary? |||
| 050:037 | In that is a reminder for whoever has a heart, or cares to listen while he is heedful.                                                              |||
| 050:038 | And We have created the heavens and the Earth and what is between them in six days, and no fatigue touched Us.                                      |||
| 050:039 | So be patient to what they are saying, and glorify the grace of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the setting.                      |||
| 050:040 | And from the night glorify Him, and after prostrating.                                                                                              |||
| 050:041 | And listen to the Day when the caller will call from a near place.                                                                                  |||
| 050:042 | The Day they hear the scream with truth. That is the Day of coming out.                                                                             |||
| 050:043 | We are the Ones who give life and bring death, and to Us is the destiny.                                                                            |||
| 050:044 | The Day when the Earth will rapidly crumble away from them; that will be a gathering which is easy for Us.                                          |||
| 050:045 | We are totally aware of what they say, and you are not to be a tyrant over them. So remind with the Quran those who fear My promise.                |||

| ------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
|         | In the name of God, the Almighty, the Most Merciful.                                    |||
| 051:001 | By the winds that blow.                                                                 |||
| 051:002 | Carrying rain.                                                                          |||
| 051:003 | Travelling easily.                                                                      |||
| 051:004 | Distributing as commanded.                                                              |||
| 051:005 | What you are being promised is true.                                                    |||
| 051:006 | And the Judgment will come to pass.                                                     |||
| 051:007 | By the sky that is clear.                                                               |||
| 051:008 | You are saying what is different.                                                       |||
| 051:009 | To mislead those who are misled.                                                        |||
| 051:010 | Woe to the deceitful.                                                                   |||
| 051:011 | Who are in mischief, unaware.                                                           |||
| 051:012 | They ask: "When is the Day of Judgment?"                                                |||
| 051:013 | The Day they ordeal upon the Fire.                                                      |||

| 051:017 | They used to rarely sleep the whole night.                                              |||
| 051:018 | And before dawn, they would seek forgiveness.                                           |||
| 051:019 | An in their money was a portion for the beggar and the needy.                           |||
| 051:020 | And in the Earth are signs for those who comprehend.                                    |||
| 051:021 | And within yourselves; do you not see?                                                  |||
| 051:022 | And in the heaven is your provision, and what you are promised.                         |||

| 051:024 | Has the story of Abraham's noble guests come to you?                                                          |||
| 051:025 | When they entered upon him, they said: "Peace." He said: "Peace to a people unknown\!"                        |||
| 051:026 | Then he went to his family and brought a fat roasted calf.                                                    |||
| 051:027 | He offered it to them, he said: "Do you not eat?"                                                             |||
| 051:028 | He then became fearful of them. They said: "Do not fear," and they gave him good news of a knowledgeable son. |||

| 051:031 | He said: "What is your undertaking, O messengers?"                                                            |||
| 051:032 | They said: "We have been sent to a criminal people."                                                          |||
| 051:033 | "To send down upon them rocks of clay."                                                                       |||
| 051:034 | "Prepared by your Lord for the transgressors."                                                                |||
| 051:035 | We then vacated from it all the believers.                                                                    |||
| 051:036 | But We only found in it one house of those who had surrendered.                                               |||
| 051:037 | And We have left in it a sign for those who fear the painful retribution.                                     |||
| 051:038 | And also Moses, for We sent him to Pharaoh with a clear authority.                                            |||
| 051:039 | But he turned away, in arrogance, and he said: "A magician, or crazy."                                        |||
| 051:040 | So We took him and his troops; We cast them into the sea, and he was to blame.                                |||
| 051:041 | And also 'Aad, for We sent upon them the hurricane wind.                                                      |||
| 051:042 | Anything that it came upon was utterly destroyed.                                                             |||
| 051:043 | And also Thamud, for it was said to them: "Enjoy for a while."                                                |||
| 051:044 | But they rebelled against the command of their Lord. So the lightning struck them while they were looking.    |||
| 051:045 | They were unable to rise up, nor could they win.                                                              |||
| 051:046 | And the people of Noah before; they were a wicked people.                                                     |||

|         |                                                                                                |||
| ------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |||
| 051:047 | And We constructed the universe using matter, and We will expand it.                           |||
| 051:048 | And the Earth We furnished; glory be to the Makers.                                            |||
| 051:049 | And from everything We created a pair, perhaps you may remember.                               |||
| 051:050 | So turn towards God. I am to you from Him a clear warner.                                      |||
| 051:051 | And do not make any other god with God. I am to you from Him a clear warner.                   |||
| 051:052 | Likewise, when a messenger went to those before them, they said: "A magician, or crazy."       |||
| 051:053 | Have they passed down this saying to each other? Indeed, they are a wicked people.             |||
| 051:054 | So turn away from them; you will not be blamed.                                                |||
| 051:055 | And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers.                                           |||
| 051:056 | I did not create the Jinn and the humans except to serve Me.                                   |||
| 051:057 | I need no provisions from them, nor do I need them to give food.                               |||
| 051:058 | God is the Provider, the One with Power, the Supreme.                                          |||
| 051:059 | The transgressors will have the same fate as their previous friends; so let them not be hasty. |||
| 051:060 | So woe to those who rejected from the Day that is waiting for them.                            |||

| 071:017 | "And God made you grow from the Earth like plants."                                                                                                                                                              |||
| 071:018 | "Then He returns you to it, and He brings you out totally?"                                                                                                                                                      |||

# Quran (Progressive Muslims Organization) 

The Qur'ān is the central religious text of Islam. Muslims believe the
Qur'an to be the literal word of God as revealed to Muhammad over a
period of twenty-three years by the angel Gabriel and regard it as God's
final revelation to mankind.

This is a Modern Literal Translation ([Free Minds](http://www.free-minds.org/)) of the
[Qur'an](/wiki/Qur%27an "Qur'an"). This text is by no means sacred as the original non-translated Arabic Quran.
